Draft Orders:

We need to talk about the Argon War, which has been raging unabated for a long time. Please return to Velika.
I have marked the meeting point on your map.

-Seir

Seir wanted to send you to the front lines of the Argon War, and while he was briefing you a messenger came to report that the Argons are in retreat, and the federation won back {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest}. Seir then ordered you to go to {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest} and help repair the area.

Ah, , you're here.

You represented {@Rgn:63001$$Velika} outstandingly and helped destroy Samael. Thank you for that. But it's not over yet."What's happened?"
It's the Argons. The threat they pose to the world is why the federation formed in the first place, and it's time for you to officially join that fight.

This second Argon War doesn't show any signs of ending, though {@Rgn:84001$$Kaiator} has for the most part contained the fighting to Northern Shara. We've been able to stamp out scattered argon incursions elsewhere in the federation, but it's time for us to go on the offensive.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"How can I help?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

You need some solid experience fighting argons, and there's only one way to get it. Argonized creatures are swarming in {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest}. I want you to travel to Northern Shara, and assist in any way you can.

Yes. Kaitor Command has established a line of defense in Northern Shara, but the argons don't fight the way we do. Containing the scattered outbreaks we see elsewhere in the federation stretches our resources too thin, and we need that to change.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I'm ready to do my part."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
Good to hear. Argonized creatures are swarming in {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest}. I want you to travel to Northern Shara, and assist in any way you can.
There's one more thing we need to do before I send you on your way. I...Hmm, what's going on here?

The argons may be retreating, but there'll still be plenty for you to fight.

Now, more than ever, I need someone like you to give our troops hope."I'll keep that in mind."

Please do. Report to {@linkcreature:247#2001$$Verge} in {@Rgn:77001$$Pathfinder Post}. If the Argons are falling back, it's our time to advance.

I want you to support our outposts in {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest} until you receive orders to go to {@Rgn:48001$$Khanovar Front}.

Greetings, . Troius told us you'd be arriving.

Let me cut to the chase.

The Argons are gone, but it'll only be for a while. The area is badly contaminated, but that doesn't change our mandate to fortify it before the Argons strike back.

Report to {@linkcreature:247#2002$$Yasring} at Field Base Lunacy as soon as possible.

One day this place was full of argons, the next day they were gone. But what they left behind...

We could study it for a lifetime, but we don't have that long."How can I help?"

They fouled the land, the water, even the air. Can you taste the wrongness in it? I'm leading the purification efforts, and to do that, I need to know exactly how argon contamination works.

Bring me some contaminated mushrooms, and kill a few argonified creatures as well. For science.
With these I can make you some cleansing orbs.
Tirkai Lake is the main source of fresh water around here, and right now it's none too fresh.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I noticed."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I'll keep turning out orbs—you use these on whatever's polluting the lake. After you use the orbs, go and meet {@creature:247#2003$$Cheniel}. You’ll need help.

Good luck!

(This corpse looks wrong somehow—not just dead, but wrong.)

(Could it be contaminating the lake? Using an orb should tell you.)
(This corpse is somehow contaminated. It could be affecting the lake. Maybe you should use an orb on it.)
(You use an orb to remove any argon contamination from the corpse.)

The lake will be clean again? If only that were enough. Our trees of life are dying. We will die without them, and soon.

But perhaps it's no accident Yasring sent you now, when you might be able to help.

If you're willing, Shemi can take you to the tree.
I can't go there, but I can show you. Look closely—they're right...here

The Purifying Orb worked?

That means there’s still hope left. The Faeries will now be able to help restore {@Rgn:47001$$Tirkai Forest}. Thanks!
